Engineering Research Center
Brown University's new Engineering Research Center (ERC) is an 80,000 square foot shared research facility open to the entire University community and external collaborators.

Welcome from the Dean














Engineering Research Center
Brown University's new Engineering Research Center (ERC) is an 80,000 square foot shared research facility open to the entire University community and external collaborators.








Engineering Research Center
Designed by KieranTimberlake and built by Shawmut Design and Construction, the Engineering Research Center (ERC) was completed in October of 2017. It connects three engineering buildings and increased the School of Engineering's research lab space by 22 percent. 
 
Building Facts
View a complete Building Fact Sheet
80,000 square feet
8,000 square feet for cleanroon, bio cleanroom, and imaging suite
1,400 square feet Class 100 cleanroom
116 workstations for graduate students and post docs
20 lab modules
6 lab clusters 
10 conference meeting spaces for groups ranging from 3 - 150
Building Features
A nano-technology cleanroom 
An advanced imaging suite 
A bio cleanroom 
Large- and small-scale collaboration spaces 
Open-plan laboratories on the second and third floors 
A multi-functional commons, café, and meeting space on level one 
Outdoor eating area adjacent to the café; green spaces for collaboration and relaxation 
Innovative energy-saving strategies such as external vertical fins to manage solar gain from the west and south 
Advanced multi-disciplinary undergraduate teaching lab
Honors
American Architecture Awards 2020, Schools and Universities
Lab Manager’s Lab Design Excellence Awards, Excellence in Innovation 
Press
Architectural Record - November 2018
KieranTimberlake (architect) building dedication release - June 2018 
Building Dedication - May 2018 
Building Opening - October 2017
Topping Off Ceremony - May 2016
Groundbreaking - October 2015
